section.title: Diameter configuration
section.p: The following table describes the application preference parameter values available for the Diameter configuration.

entry.p: This application preference can be configured so that the overlapping session binding information is constrained to a Diameter peer during session replacement.

When this application preference is set to true, the Diameter peer is considered, which is useful in cases where a gateway uses overlapping IP address pools. When set to false, the Diameter peer is not considered when session replacement occurs.

Warning: Sessions may be lost if you attempt to set this application preference to “false” after the system has been running with this application preference set to “true”. If this application preference is set to “true”, duplicate sessions with the same IPv4 address are allowed if they are on different diameter peers; however, if after setting the application preference to true, you then set the application preference to “false”, the next new session to be created with that IPv4 address will cause all other sessions to be terminated.

row.entry: The Generic Binding database records become subject to audit after a specified interval. The audit removes records that have a timestamp that is older than the age specified by the Generic Binding Inactivity Duration application preference parameter at the time the audit runs.

entry.p: Contact Technical Support for assistance if you need to tag specific Generic Binding database records so that they are ignored by the audit and stored permanently.
When enabled (true) you are setting a flag that enables the monitoring of peers connected through the DiameterIO. It checks whether all peer connections have been lost (if there was at least one).
By default it is set to false.
See the “NCC Monitoring” section in the NCC Administration Guide for more information.
